com.ojcoleman.ahni.util

Class PostProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.ahni.util.PostProcess

  • public class PostProcess
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains utility methods to perform post-processing on the results of a run or multiple runs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argsArray)

      • compressAverage

        public static void compressAverage(java.io.BufferedReader resultsReader,
                   java.io.BufferedWriter resultsWriter,
                   int size)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Given a result file from a set of runs, for each run computes averages over some number of generations (the window size) within the run. This is useful if the results are to be plotted and the plotting software can't handle many thousands of data points.
        Parameters:
        resultsReader - input stream to read data from file containing the original results.
        resultsWriter - output stream to write generated data.
        size - the desired size of the output file (number of result averages). The window size is then computed as ([number of original generations] / size).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • compressAverage

        public static Results compressAverage(Results results,
                      int size)
        Given a result file from a set of runs, for each run computes averages over some number of generations (the window size) within the run. This is useful if the results are to be plotted and the plotting software can't handle many thousands of data points.
        Parameters:
        results - results to compress.
        size - the desired size of the output file (number of result averages). The window size is then computed as ([number of original generations] / size).
        Returns:
        the compressed results.

      • generateStats

        public static void generateStats(java.io.BufferedReader resultsReader,
                 java.io.BufferedWriter resultsWriter)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Given a result file from a set of runs, create a new file that contains basic statistics over the runs for each generation.
        Parameters:
        resultsReader - input stream to read data from file containing the original results.
        resultsWriter - output stream to write generated data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • combineResults

        public static void combineResults(java.lang.String filePattern,
                  java.io.BufferedWriter resultsWriter)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Combine the results from multiple runs into one file.
        Parameters:
        filePattern - The path to the result files. The pattern supports the typical glob format, and in order to match more than one file must necessarily include wildcard characters such as ? or *.
        resultsWriter - A stream to write the results to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • combineResults

        public static Results combineResults(java.lang.String filePattern,
                     boolean verbose)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Combine the results from multiple runs into one Results object.
        Parameters:
        filePattern - The path to the result files. The pattern supports the typical glob format, and in order to match more than one file must necessarily include wildcard characters such as ? or *.
        Returns:
        A Results object containing the combined results.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • extractFinal

        public static void extractFinal(java.lang.String filePattern,
                java.io.BufferedWriter resultsWriter)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Combine the final line from multiple result files into one file. There will be one line for each result file in the output file.
        Parameters:
        filePattern - The path to the result files. The pattern supports the typical glob format, and in order to match more than one file must necessarily include wildcard characters such as ? or *.
        resultsWriter - A stream to write the results to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
